Early-Bird Tickets Now Available

Conference

14-16 April 2016

€159

BUY NOW

"Early Bird" tickets (€99/€169/€79) are limited. Standard price for Resonate 2016 is €159/€249/€119. Tickets include both day and night events of selected programme.

Tickets for 3-day workshops (11 - 13 April) will be available at later date. 3-day workshops tickets do not include main entry ticket to the festival.

Sign-ups for free 1-day workshops will be open in early February 2016. Access to 1-day workshops is based on application process and all workshops are FREE if you have a ticket to relevant Resonate programme (above).

Full Programme

12-16 April 2016

€249

BUY NOW

Like every year, Resonate is committed to supporting education in Serbia and will again enable over 150 students from Serbia FREE access to conference programme at Resonate 2016. These tickets require proof of being a student of higher education institution in Serbia – “Indeks” and are subject to application and availability. Application for these tickets will also be open in early February 2016.

Live

12-16 April 2016

€119

BUY NOW

All tickets are transferable but not refundable (free student tickets are NOT transferable). Contact us if you need to transfer your ticket to someone else. We will not mail you tickets. Just bring your email confirmation and ID to the festival registration area and we’ll be ready for you. You don’t need to sign up for specific sessions apart from 1 day and 3 day workshops. Seating in all areas including general sessions, breakouts, labs and lounges is first come, first serve.

About Resonate

Resonate is a platform for networking, knowledge sharing and education. It brings together artists, designers and educators to participate in a forward-looking debate on the position of technology in art and culture.

Held each year in Belgrade-Serbia, the festival lasts for five days and provides an overview of current situation in the fields of music, visual arts and digital culture. Guest artists, lecturers and other participants are chosen to represent the cutting edge of the contemporary creative industry in the world.

Past Participants

Aaron Koblin, Casey Reas, Joachim Sauter, Kimchi And Chips, Wesley Grubbs, Anthony Dunne (RCA), Josh Nimoy, Jer Thorp, Champagne Valentine, Jack Schulze, Nelly Ben Hayoun, Cohen Van Balen, LAb[au], Rafaël Rozendaal, James Bridle, Joshua Noble, Hi-Res!, Golan Levin, Ivan Poupyrev, United Visual Artists, Zach Lieberman, FIELD, WARP, onedotzero, Kim Gordon + Ikue Mori, Alva Noto + Blixa Bargeld (anbb), Mouse on Mars, Pantha du Prince, Simian Mobile Disco, Machinedrum, Ben Frost and many more...
